properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing baseball sized hail and damaging winds in excess of 110 km/h. At 7:54 PM CST Doppler RADAR indicated that this severe thunderstorm was located just southeast of Eston and was moving toward the east at 50 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2019-07-15T04:14:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T01:55:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0854218514.2019
Area: R.M. of Lacadena including Kyle Tyner and Sanctuary, R.M. of Monet including Elrose Wartime and Forgan, R.M. of Snipe Lake including Eston and Plato
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-15T04:59:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T23:25:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2200958738.2019

properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:44 p.m. MST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. Radar indicates a line of severe thunderstorms about 30 km east of Tumbler Ridge are moving eastward at 30 km/h towards Route 52. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca.

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots. Strong to severe thunderstorms are expected to develop over Lake Manitoba this evening which will persist into the overnight hours. Similar thunderstorms are likely over the south basin of Lake Winnipeg overnight and into Monday morning. Wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected in some of these thunderstorms. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
